books.title: Wired Love
books.author: Ella Cheever Thayer
books.summary: A romance begins over the wire between two telegraph operators.

books.title: Allan Quatermain
books.author: H. Rider Haggard
books.summary: Adventurer Allan Quatermain sets out on a mission to Africa to locate a mysterious tribe of white-skinned people.

books.title: The Autobiography of Mark Twain
books.author: Mark Twain
books.summary: A collection of reminiscences and reflections from the author’s experiences.

books.title: The Lives and Opinions of Eminent Philosophers
books.author: Diogenes Laërtius
books.summary: Brief biographies of the prominent philosophers of ancient Greece.

books.title: Pollyanna Grows Up
books.author: Eleanor H. Porter
books.summary: Pollyanna recovers from an automobile accident with the help of a nearby dowager, before leaving the country to later return to rural Vermont.

books.title: Indiscretions of Archie
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: When Englishman Archie Moffam makes a complaint about his room to the owner of the New York hotel, his life is changed forever.

books.title: The Seagull
books.author: Anton Chekhov
books.summary: A has-been actress, her ambitious playwright son, a male writer, and an aspiring young actress struggle to realize their romantic and artistic aims.

books.title: Master Flea
books.author: E. T. A. Hoffmann
books.summary: A gentleman bachelor gains an epic advantage of tiny proportions in this allegorical, Romantic, fairy-tale novel.

books.title: Winesburg, Ohio
books.author: Sherwood Anderson
books.summary: The residents of a small pre-industrial Ohio town lead their lives amidst a backdrop of pervasive loneliness.

books.title: The Dark Other
books.author: Stanley G. Weinbaum
books.summary: A young woman seeks the reason behind her lover’s outbursts of cruelty.

books.title: Up from Slavery
books.author: Booker T. Washington
books.summary: The autobiography of Booker T. Washington, former slave and founder of the Tuskegee Institute.

books.title: The Big Bow Mystery
books.author: Israel Zangwill
books.summary: A seemingly impossible murder committed during the trade union movement becomes the obsession of London’s Bow district.

books.title: The Cruise of the Alerte
books.author: E. F. Knight
books.summary: An English journalist sets sail in search of treasure buried on a remote desert island.

books.title: Dialogues
books.author: Plato
books.summary: A collection of Plato’s dialogues.

books.title: Spoon River Anthology
books.author: Edgar Lee Masters
books.summary: A collection of short poems recounting the lives and deaths of the residents of a small Illinois town.

books.title: The History of Rasselas, Prince of Abyssinia
books.author: Samuel Johnson
books.summary: An Abyssinian prince embarks on adventures while exploring the meaning of happiness.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Fritz Leiber
books.summary: A collection of Fritz Leiber short stories and novellas ordered by date of publication.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Vsevolod Garshin
books.summary: A collection of Garshin’s translated short stories and novellas ordered by date of publication.

books.title: Heretics
books.author: G. K. Chesterton
books.summary: A collection of essays in which G. K. Chesterton debates the intellectuals of his day on a range of topics.

books.title: On a Chinese Screen
books.author: W. Somerset Maugham
books.summary: A collection of short vignettes about the people and places W. Somerset Maugham encountered during his travels along the Yangtze River in 1919–20.
